meanings.definition: A bill that is prepared in advance
meanings.sent1: I always review the prebills before finalizing the invoices.
meanings.sent2: The accountant organized the prebills neatly in a folder.
meanings.sent3: The prebills were so early, they beat the sunrise!
meanings.sent4: Her stack of prebills was like a tower of pending payments.
meanings.sent5: The prebills fluttered in the wind, reminding me of upcoming expenses.

meanings.definition: To prepare a bill in advance
meanings.sent1: We need to prebills the invoices for next month's clients.
meanings.sent2: She prebills all the bills to avoid last-minute rush.
meanings.sent3: He decided to prebills the bills while sipping his morning coffee.
meanings.sent4: The company prebills the bills like clockwork every month.
meanings.sent5: Prebilling the bills early helps in better financial planning.
